newsitem.title: UK: U.S. stocks in London on hold ahead of Fed meeting.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks in London on hold ahead of Fed meeting.

text.p: U.S. shares were little changed to slightly lower in quiet European trade as most investors stayed away ahead of the two-day Federal Open Markets Committee(FOMC) meeting which begins later on Tuesday.
"It's very dull. People want to get the FOMC out of the way before doing anything," one market maker said. "It would be a nasty shock if the Fed put up rates this week."
U.S. treasuries were steady after rising overnight on speculation the Fed will refrain from lifting rates due to recent signs that inflation remains dormant.
Although the Fed is expected to keep interest rates on hold, traders said the bond market was likely to pull back slightly after the meeting.
"The shorts have been taken out, so the market is a little long," said a trader at a Japanese bank in London.
The March T-bond was down 1/32 at 112-2/32 by 1100 GMT.

WMX Technologies was up $5/8 at $36-3/4 after the company announced a 50 million share repurchase programme as well as a new business strategy that includes cutting capital spending by $900 million in 1997 and the divestiture of $1.5 billion in assets.
Pepsi was down $1/4 at $33-7/8 ahead of the release of its fourth-quarter figures later today.
"Some people fear Pepsi's restaurant businesses haven't been doing too well which is hurting the shares this morning," one dealer said.
Colgate, which is also due to publish Q4 figures today, was up $3/8 at $96-5/8.
The S&P 500 futures contract on the Globex after-hours trading system was up 0.15 at 789.90.
